page.title: 12SHOPPING IN BRAILES
page.content: Shopping facilities in Brailes cater for the daily needs of the people. More expensive durable items are purchased in nearby towns. There are two general stores, one incorporates a Post Office, the other sells alcohol. Two garages supply petrol and offer repairs to cars and agricultural machinery. Milk is delivered on alternate days and mobile vans bring bread, meat and fish. Other amenities are a hairdressing salon, a garden centre, a blacksmith's shop and a mobile library. There are two public houses and a restaurant with overnight accommodation which provides meals for special occasions. The services of builders, plumbers, electricians, an undertaker and a television engineer are available in the village.
